required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of MEDI9090 in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study to Evaluate the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of MEDI9090 in Subjects With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, study of MEDI9090 to evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK, immunogenicity, and antitumor activity of MEDI9090 in adult subjects with advanced solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects reporting infusion related reactions
primary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study medication through 30 days after the first dose of study medication

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects that develop changes in detectable antidrug antibodies to MEDI9090
primary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study medication through 6 months after the last dose of study medication

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study medication through 3 months after the last dose of study medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects reporting adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening through 3 months after last dose of study medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects reporting serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening through 3 months after the last dose of study medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with vital sign abnormalities reported as adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening through 3 months after the last dose of study medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with ECG abnormalities reported as adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening through 3 months after the last dose of study medication

intervention.description: MEDI9090 will be administered by IV infusion
Durvalumab (MEDI4736) will be administered by IV infusion following MEDI9090

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects
- 18 years and older
- Must have histologic documentation of advanced solid tumors
- Must have received and have progressed, are refractory or, intolerant to standard therapy and must not have a curative therapy option
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent enrollment in another clinical study
- Prior participation in clinical studies that include durvalumab alone or in combination
- Concurrent chemotherapy, immunotherapy, biologic, or hormonal therapy for cancer treatment
